objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: The UK National Cyber Security Centre; author/publisher of this technical analysis report and author of multiple SIGMA and YARA detection rules included in the report.

objects.name: SparrowDoor mutex
objects.description: Mutex created by SparrowDoor to ensure only one instance runs (Global\gup0).

objects.name: Configured proxy IP
objects.description: Proxy IP present in the malware configuration (used if proxy specified).

objects.name: Indicator for libcurl.dll MD5 (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of libcurl.dll (SparrowDoor 32-bit loader).

objects.name: Indicator for libcurl.dll SHA-1 (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of libcurl.dll (SparrowDoor 32-bit loader).

objects.name: Indicator for libcurl.dll SHA-256 (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of libcurl.dll (SparrowDoor 32-bit loader).

objects.name: Indicator for libhost.dll MD5 (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of libhost.dll (SparrowDoor backdoor).

objects.name: Indicator for libhost.dll SHA-1 (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of libhost.dll (SparrowDoor backdoor).

objects.name: Indicator for libhost.dll SHA-256 (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of libhost.dll (SparrowDoor backdoor).

objects.name: Indicator for SearchIndexer.exe MD5 (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of SearchIndexer.exe (malicious renamed Notepad++ updater).

objects.name: Indicator for SearchIndexer.exe SHA-1 (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of SearchIndexer.exe (malicious renamed Notepad++ updater).

objects.name: Indicator for SearchIndexer.exe SHA-256 (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of SearchIndexer.exe (malicious renamed Notepad++ updater).

objects.name: sparrowdoor
objects.description: A persistent 32-bit loader and backdoor for Windows. SparrowDoor uses a side-loaded malicious libcurl.dll loader and an obfuscated libhost.dll payload (non-PE with custom structure) which is reflectively loaded. Features include reflective loading of a PE payload with no headers, XOR-based configuration and C2 encoding, AV-detection via hardcoded process names, inline API hooking (including socket APIs and credential-related APIs), token impersonation using the explorer.exe token (privilege downgrade), process injection into a spawned suspended svchost.exe, HTTPS-based C2 communications (proxy aware) with XOR-obfuscated tasking and beaconing, clipboard logging (‘clipshot’), file read/write and delete tasking, reverse shell support and exfiltration over the C2 channel. The malware implements persistence by installing a Windows service (SearchIndexer) or adding a Run key and supports a clean-up routine to remove its artifacts.

objects.name: T1543.003 Create or Modify System Process: Windows Service
objects.description: SparrowDoor achieves persistence by installing SearchIndexer.exe as a Windows service, using parameters defined in the malware configuration.

objects.name: T1547.001 Boot or Logon Autostart Execution: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder
objects.description: If SparrowDoor fails to persist as a Windows Service, it installs SearchIndexer.exe in the Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run registry key as a backup persistence mechanism.

objects.name: T1134.001 Access Token Manipulation
objects.description: SparrowDoor impersonates the user account token associated with the explorer.exe process prior to network connections and some API modifications. This appears to be used as an operational security/privilege downgrade technique so network activity and resource access are performed under a less-privileged user token.

objects.name: T1140 Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
objects.description: The SparrowDoor backdoor (libhost.dll) is obfuscated with a 4-byte XOR key and the configuration is obfuscated with an 8-byte XOR key; the loader deobfuscates these before executing or parsing configuration.

objects.name: T1574.002 Hijack Execution Flow: DLL Side-Loading
objects.description: SparrowDoor gains execution via DLL side-loading: a legitimate signed Notepad++ updater was renamed to SearchIndexer.exe which loads libcurl; the malicious libcurl.dll is placed alongside it and is side-loaded to run the loader functionality.

objects.name: T1055.012 Process Injection: Portable Executable Injection
objects.description: During initialization SparrowDoor spawns and suspends an instance of svchost.exe and injects the backdoor payload into that process, causing the backdoor to run in an orphaned svchost.exe with an abnormal parent.

objects.name: T1070.004 Indicator Removal on Host: File Deletion
objects.description: SparrowDoor supports tasking that deletes arbitrary files and firmware related files, and it has a victim clean-up task to delete persistence mechanisms and the files SearchIndexer.exe, libcurl.dll and libhost.dll retrieved from environment variables.

objects.name: T1620 Reflective Code Loading
objects.description: The backdoor is reflectively loaded by code in libhost.dll; the loader configuration and shellcode are used to reflectively load the payload in memory without standard PE headers.

objects.name: T1036.005 Masquerading: Match Legitimate Name or Location
objects.description: The malware renames a signed Notepad++ updater to SearchIndexer.exe (the name of a legitimate Windows binary) and uses legitimate library names such as libcurl.dll to masquerade as benign components.

objects.name: T1218 Signed Binary Proxy Execution
objects.description: A legitimately signed Notepad++ updater (renamed to SearchIndexer.exe) is used to load the malicious libcurl.dll, enabling execution under the context of a signed binary.

objects.name: T1518.001 Software Discovery: Security Software Discovery
objects.description: SparrowDoor enumerates running processes and checks them against a hardcoded list of AV process names; configuration controls whether detections enforce task blocking.

objects.name: T1071.001 Application Layer Protocol: Web Protocols
objects.description: SparrowDoor uses HTTPS for command-and-control communications (HTTP POST), is proxy-aware, and includes hardcoded HTTP header fields and beacon/exfil structures.

objects.name: T1573.001 Encrypted Channel: Symmetric Cryptography
objects.description: The malware uses static XOR keys to encode beacon, tasking and exfiltration data, providing a symmetric obfuscation layer under HTTPS.

objects.name: T1115 Clipboard Data
objects.description: SparrowDoor provides a 'clipshot' task that logs clipboard data to a file (libcurl.dll.log) by spawning a rundll32.exe process under the explorer.exe token to call an export in libcurl.dll.

objects.name: T1041 Exfiltration Over C2 Channel
objects.description: SparrowDoor exfiltrates files and directory listings over its HTTPS C2 channel; exfiltrated data is obfuscated with the same XOR key as beacons.

objects.name: ESET
objects.description: Security vendor referenced as having reported an earlier variant of SparrowDoor in September 2021; cited as prior reporter/industry source.

objects.name: 360.cn
objects.description: AV vendor referenced in the AV process list (associated with process name ZhuDongFangYu.exe) that SparrowDoor checks for during security software discovery.

objects.name: Kaspersky
objects.description: AV vendor referenced in the AV process list (associated with process name avp.exe) that SparrowDoor checks for during security software discovery.

objects.name: ESET (process egui.exe)
objects.description: AV vendor referenced via its process name egui.exe in the report's AV process detection list.

objects.name: Symantec
objects.description: Security vendor referenced in the AV process list (several Symantec-related process names) that the malware checks for.

objects.name: Trend Micro
objects.description: AV vendor referenced in the AV process list (TMBMSRV.exe) that SparrowDoor can check for as part of its AV-detection routine.

objects.name: Comodo Firewall Pro
objects.description: Security vendor referenced in the AV process list (cpf.exe) that the malware checks for.

objects.name: McAfee
objects.description: AV vendor referenced in the AV process list (Mcshield.exe) that SparrowDoor checks for.

objects.name: Norton
objects.description: AV vendor referenced in the AV process list (ccSetMgr.exe and related Symantec/Norton processes) that the malware checks for.

objects.name: SparrowDoor_apipatch
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule SparrowDoor_apipatch {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"

  description = "Identifies code segments in SparrowDoor
responsible for patching APIs. No MZ/PE match as the backdoor has no
header. Targeting in memory."
        date = "2022-02-28"
        hash1 = "c1890a6447c991880467b86a013dbeaa66cc615f"
    strings:
        $save = {8B 06 89 07 8A 4E 04} // save off first 5 bytes of
function

  $vp_1 = {89 10 8A 4E 04 8B D6 2B D0 88 48 04 83 EA 05 C6 40 05 E9

89 50 06} // calculate long jump

  $vp_2 = {50 8B D6 6A 40 2B D7 88 4F 04 83 EA 05 6A 05 C6 47 05 E9

89 57 06 56} // calculate long jump 2

  $vp_3 = {51 52 2B DE 6A 05 83 EB 05 56 C6 06 E9 89 5E 01} //
restore memory protections

  $va = {6A 40 68 00 10 00 00 68 00 10 00 00 6A 00} // virtually

alloc set size, allocation and protection

  $s_patch = {50 68 7F FF FF FF 68 FF FF 00 00 56} // socket patch

SO_DONTLINGER

    condition:

    3 of them

}

objects.name: SparrowDoor_clipshot
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
import "pe"
rule SparrowDoor_clipshot {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"

  description = "The SparrowDoor loader contains a feature it calls
clipshot, which logs clipboard data to a file."
        date = "2022-02-28"
        hash1 = "989b3798841d06e286eb083132242749c80fdd4d"
    strings:
        $exsting_cmp = {8B 1E 3B 19 75 ?? 83 E8 04 83 C1 04 83 C6 04 83
F8 04} // comparison routine for previous clipboard data

  $time_format_string = "%d/%d/%d %d:%d" ascii
  $cre_fil_args = {6A 00 68 80 00 00 00 6A 04 6A 00 6A 02 68 00 00

00 40 52}
    condition:
        (uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and
all of them and (pe.imports("User32.dll","OpenClipboard") and
pe.imports("User32.dll","GetClipboardData") and
pe.imports("Kernel32.dll","GetLocalTime") and
pe.imports("Kernel32.dll","GlobalSize"))

}

objects.name: SparrowDoor_config
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule SparrowDoor_config {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"

  description = "Targets the XOR encoded loader config and
shellcode in the file libhost.dll using the known position of the XOR
key."
        date = "2022-02-28"
        hash1 = "c1890a6447c991880467b86a013dbeaa66cc615f"
    condition:
        (uint16(0) != 0x5A4D) and
        (uint16(0) != 0x8b55) and

  (uint32(0) ^ uint32(0x4c) ==  0x00) and
  (uint32(0) ^ uint32(0x34) ==  0x00) and
  (uint16(0) ^ uint16(0x50) ==  0x8b55)

}

objects.name: SparrowDoor_loader
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule SparrowDoor_loader {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"

  description = "Targets code features of the SparrowDoor loader.
This rule detects the previous variant and this new variant."
        date = "2022-02-28"
        hash1 = "989b3798841d06e286eb083132242749c80fdd4d"
    strings:

  $xor_algo = {8B D0 83 E2 03 8A 54 14 10 30 14 30 40 3B C1}
  $rva = {8D B0 [4] 8D 44 24 ?? 50 6A 40 6A 05 56} // load RVA of

process exe
        $lj = {2B CE 83 E9 05 8D [3] 52 C6 06 E9 89 4E 01 8B [3] 50 6A 05
56} // calculate long jump
    condition:
        (uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and
all of them

}

objects.name: SparrowDoor_shellcode
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.

objects.name: SparrowDoor_sleep_routine
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule SparrowDoor_sleep_routine {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "SparrowDoor implements a Sleep routine with value
seeded on GetTickCount. This signature detects the previous and this
variant of SparrowDoor. No MZ/PE match as the backdoor has no header.
Targeting in memory."
        date = "2022-02-28"
        hash1 = "c1890a6447c991880467b86a013dbeaa66cc615f"

    strings:
        $sleep = {FF D7 33 D2 B9 [4] F7 F1 81 C2 [4] 8B C2 C1 E0 04 2B C2
03 C0 03 C0 03 C0 50}

    condition:

  all of them

}

objects.name: SparrowDoor_xor
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule SparrowDoor_xor {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"

  description = "Highlights XOR routines in SparrowDoor. No MZ/PE
match as the backdoor has no header. Targeting in memory."
        date = "2022-02-28"
        hash1 = "c1890a6447c991880467b86a013dbeaa66cc615f"
    strings:
        $xor_routine_outbound = {B8 39 8E E3 38 F7 E1 D1 EA 8D 14 D2 8B
C1 2B C2 8A [4] 00 30 14 39 41 3B CE}

  $xor_routine_inbound = {B8 25 49 92 24 F7 E1 8B C1 2B C2 D1 E8 03

C2 C1 E8 02 8D 14 C5 [4] 2B D0 8B C1 2B C2}
        $xor_routine_config = {8B D9 83 E3 07 0F [6] 30 18 8D 1C 07 83 E3
07 0F [6] 30 58 01 8D 1C 28 83 E3 07 0F [6] 30 58 02 8D 1C 02 83 E3 07 0F
[6] 30 58 03 8B DE 83 E3 07 0F [6] 30 58 04 83 C6 05 83 C1 05}
    condition:
        2 of them

}

objects.name: SparrowDoor_strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule SparrowDoor_strings {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Strings that appear in SparrowDoor's backdoor.
Targeting in memory."
        date = "2022-02-28"
        hash1 = "c1890a6447c991880467b86a013dbeaa66cc615f"

    strings:
        $reg = "Software\\Microsoft\\Windows\\CurrentVersion\\Run" ascii

$http_headers = {55 73 65 72 2D 41 67 65 6E 74 3A 20 4D 6F 7A 69 6C

6C 61 2F 34 2E 30 20 28 63 6F 6D 70 61 74 69 62 6C 65 3B 20 4D 53 49 45
20 35 2E 30 3B 20 57 69 6E 64 6F 77 73 20 4E 54 20 35 2E 30 29 0D 0A 41
63 63 65 70 74 2D 4C 61 6E 67 75 61 67 65 3A 20 65 6E 2D 55 53 0D 0A 41
63 63 65 70 74 3A 20 2A 2F 2A 0D 0A}

$http_proxy = "HTTPS=HTTPS://%s:%d" ascii
$debug = "SeDebugPrivilege" ascii
$av1 = "avp.exe" ascii // Kaspersky
$av2 = "ZhuDongFangYu.exe" ascii // Qihoo360
$av3 = "egui.exe" ascii // ESET
$av4 = "TMBMSRV.exe" ascii // Trend Micro
$av5 = "ccSetMgr.exe" ascii // Norton
$clipshot = "clipshot" ascii
$ComSpec =  "ComSpec" ascii
$export = "curl_easy_init" ascii

    condition:
        10 of them

}

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Sparrowdoor
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. sparrowdoor.
